div.p: Folder 1, box 91, Hector papers, Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Wellington.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: center;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Note on file: 'Read at Board on 12 Nov 97'.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
New Zealand Institute.
The titular President of the Institute was the Governor, the Earl of Glasgow, but James Hector as Director was its active head.

I am requested by the Council of the Royal Society of Tasmania to intimate that they will be very glad to join in any action which may be taken by kindred Societies to raise some lasting memorial of the late Baron Von Müeller whose irreparable loss we have all to deplore.

I may add, our first intention in view of our deep obligations to the deceased, was to do something locally in perpetuation of his memory. As the work of Baron Von Müeller however was of a distinctly national rather than of a merely local character it was thought that perhaps a memorial under the auspices of an institution representing all the Colonies, such as the Australasian Association for the Advancement of Science, might be considered as more suitable than provincial ones, and therefore no local action has been taken.
